meanings.definition: The quality or state of being traceable.
meanings.sent1: The traceability of the missing toy helped the child find it easily.
meanings.sent2: The traceability of the ingredients in the recipe ensured its authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The detective's traceability of the suspect's movements led to a surprising revelation.
meanings.sent4: The traceability of the rumor back to its source stopped its spread.
meanings.sent5: The traceability of the footprints in the snow pointed directly to the culprit.

meanings.definition: The ability to trace or track something back to its origin or source.
meanings.sent1: The traceability of the shipment allowed for quick retrieval.
meanings.sent2: The traceability of the virus outbreak was crucial for containment.
meanings.sent3: The traceability of the lost keys turned into a fun treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: The traceability of the melody to its composer added depth to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The traceability of the leak in the pipe saved the house from flooding.
